description.narrative: IR 4.2: Planning & Strategic InformationGovernmental systems are collecting, analyzing and using appropriately disaggregated data to enable national and local governments effectively plan, coordinate, implement and monitor quality interventions and achievement of programme results are supported through results based planning and management, including strategic information management.,which contributes to Child Health, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Data And Child Protection, Field/Country Office Oversight, Management And Operations Support, Health Systems Strengthening, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Y108 - PCR 4 Cross SectoralIn target districts schools, health facilities and communities in emergency settings have improved water and sanitation facilities o and CLTS is introduced in target villages.b) Increased influence of youth on national agenda for realization child rights, effective participatory communication processes for child focused behavioural and social change and increased awareness at national and international levels of situation of children and women in Uganda.c) Responsiveness of UN Delivery-As- One to child rights and development/scaling up of technological innovative approaches for improved service delivery, accountability and transparency.

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 4.2: Planning & Strategic InformationGovernmental systems are collecting, analyzing and using appropriately disaggregated data to enable national and local governments effectively plan, coordinate, implement and monitor quality interventions; and achievement of programme results are supported through results based planning and management, including strategic information management.
Number of districts whose strategic plans for statistical development have been revised or developed
Number of additional critical child-focused indicators included in the 2011 DHS, the 2012 Population and Housing Census and other national surveys' tools

actual.value: 2015:5- this was achieved. Furthermore, UNICEF has advocated for the inclusion of MICS ECD module and home-based approach to child discipline and OVC questions in the 2016 DHS questionnaire

target.value: 2015:All RWPs ready for signing by June every year

title.narrative: Percentage of the monitoring activities of the IMEP implemented

actual.value: 2015:This indicator is covered under total HACT assurance activities. 116% of planned HACT assurance activities completed
